comment._content: I so would have loved to have lived during these times!

comment.author: 7852394@N04
comment._content: Just a hint of the zeppelin. It's refreshing to see the curiousity of the several viewers 'frozen' :)

comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: This must be the future George V. If it was really shot in 1910, it must be early in the year, as his father died and he became king-emperor in May. It's possible that this was shot after George V ascended the throne, in which case the PoW would be the young man in the checkered cap, the future Edward VIII, who was but 16 in 1910.

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: The Prince of Wales in this photo is Edward Albert Christian George Andrew Patrick David Windsor (1894-1972), later to be King Edward VIII and, after his abdication, Duke of Windsor.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...

comment._content: I agree with whaduck.  It's HRH the PoW, future Edward VIII.

comment._content: fantastic... i completely amazed by your collection. Simply love it!

comment.author: 25252126@N08
comment._content: Beautiful capture absolutely lovely ! Well done!!

comment.author: 90983012@N00
comment._content:
Undoubtedly the future Duke of Windsor, Edward VIII. He was a small and slim gentleman like his father, King George V. of Great Britain. It is fascinating to see this photo because the last German Emperor William II. (1859-1941) was the oldest grandson of the famous Queen Victoria.
The Duke of Windsor was the great-grandson of Queen Victoria !

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This photograph was taken on Monday, March 31, 1913 outside the Zeppelin works at Friedrichschafen. See the backgrounder in the comments at associated photograph here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3219731247/in/p...
